revised_title: Inositol Lipids and Neural Function: Metabolism and Actions of Inositol Metabolites in Mammalian Brain
tldr: This article discusses the role of inositol lipid signaling pathways in the nervous system, focusing on the NG115-401L cell line. The authors describe the metabolism and actions of inositol metabolites, particularly inositol phosphate isomers, and their relation to intracellular calcium homeostasis. They also explore the use of pharmacological reagents to intervene in the signaling sequence and the potential roles of inositol polyphosphates, InsP5, and InsP6 in the nervous system.
